title: The Apprentice airs huge win as winning team bag £1m profit
text:
Empower had a storming win on the show (Picture: BBC)

The Apprentice aired a huge win in the latest episode as Team Empower stormed to victory with over £1m worth of sales.

In Wednesday’s installment the teams were tasked with designing and selling electric bikes, along with accessories.

Empower, led by Iasha Masood, created an Aphrodite bike aimed at a client they called Sophisticated Sarah.

Meanwhile Thomas Skinner’s team Team Unison had a bit of a mare as they couldn’t agree on the branding or the design of their electric bike.

At the last minute Thomas decided to completely change the marketing as he didn’t like the original title of Boundary.

He decided to call it ‘E-fit’ instead, but still wasn’t happy with the red colour of the bike with a white rocket printed on the front.

Despite Empower being unimpressed with Aphrodite, it came good in the end as Lord Sugar was stunned by how much money they had managed to make.

We feel your pain Unison (Picture: BBC)

In the boardroom Lord Sugar’s Aide Claude Littner revealed that they had received orders of £1.2m for the electric bike.

Compared to Unison’s £437,000 (a number not to be sniffed at anyway) they stormed to victory in what You’re Fired host Tom Allen claimed was the most money ever made in a single task.

One design included some rather questionable ‘bike balls’ (Picture: BBC)

Thomas narrowly escaped being fired by Lord Sugar, and it was Lubna Farham who ultimately bit the dust.

Despite being pleased to have left the show, the mum-of-two exclusively told Metro.co.uk that they didn’t show her response to Lord Sugar when she was fired.

‘I contributed to every single element in the task and in the boardroom when Lord Sugar asked me “what did you do?” my actual answer wasn’t the answer that was shown on TV,’ she explained.

‘I gave him a list of things that I did and they didn’t show it.

‘Scarlett and Tommy were actually having an argument in the boardroom and I broke the argument up. Tommy did lose his temper several times during the process and I did calm him down a lot, and that wasn’t shown either.’

The episode ended with a surprise visit from Lord Sugar to the candidates’ London pad, explaining that they would be off to Oxford in the next episode for the classic shopping task.
